text:
Marisa Pavan (born Maria Luisa Pierangeli; 19 June 1932) is an Italian actress. She is known as the twin sister of actress Pier Angeli. She was born in Cagliari, Sardinia.
Her first movie role was in "The Rose Tattoo" (1955). Her performance earned a nomination for an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress. She also won the Golden Globe Award.
She also starred in "Diane" (1956), "The Man in the Gray Flannel Suit" (1956), "The Midnight Story" (1957) and "John Paul Jones" (1959).
In 1956, Pavan married French actor Jean-Pierre Aumont. They were married until his death in 2001. They had two sons.
